sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Use Short Name Path in Command Line
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description: Detect use of the Windows 8.3 short name. Which could be used as a method to avoid command-line detection

sigma_analysis_results.rule_title: Load Of RstrtMgr.DLL By An Uncommon Process
sigma_analysis_results.rule_description:
Detects the load of RstrtMgr DLL (Restart Manager) by an uncommon process.
This library has been used during ransomware campaigns to kill processes that would prevent file encryption by locking them (e.g. Conti ransomware, Cactus ransomware). It has also recently been seen used by the BiBi wiper for Windows.
It could also be used for anti-analysis purposes by shut downing specific processes.

match_context.values: @{Product=Microsoft\xae Windows\xae Operating System; Hashes=SHA1=E73CC7B108B1509663366C7B6EB3EE9F34C81BC0,MD5=7C2EB91CE1A90EE355DACA061FC12CB3,SHA256=27CED8D6D6F07C09CB1277FE69FC64CF087ABB4EB5B85DCEB7DA1175DCC9E479,IMPHASH=682F7D32AA9331B44703F9533C0C3308; OriginalFileName=RstrtMgr.dll; ImageLoaded=C:\Windows\System32\RstrtMgr.dll; Description=Restart Manager; SignatureStatus=Valid; EventID=7; FileVersion=10.0.17134.1 (WinBuild.160101.0800); Signed=true; Signature=Microsoft Windows; Image=C:\Users\george\AppData\Local\Temp\3582-490\file.exe; Company=Microsoft Corporation}

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: Detects malware by known bad imphash or rich_pe_header_hash
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Arnim Rupp

crowdsourced_yara_results.description: YARA rule to detect if a sqllang.dll version is targeted by skip-2.0. Each byte pattern corresponds to a function hooked by skip-2.0. If $1_0 or $1_1 match, it is probably targeted as it corresponds to the hook responsible for bypassing the authentication.
crowdsourced_yara_results.author: Mathieu Tartare <mathieu.tartare@eset.com>
